resources.string: Compared to your average for this bean:
Bean name already exists\nTip: Try adding the roaster name or roast level to make it unique
No shots found for these filters. Try adjusting to see your brewing journey.
Add your first coffee bean to start tracking shots
Add some beans in Bean Management to get started
Ready to start your coffee journey? Record your first shot and I\'ll help you dial in your beans!
Database filled with test data successfully!
Shot recorded successfully! Brew ratio: %1$s, Time: %2$s
Based on %1$ds extraction time, the shot might taste sour (under-extracted)
Based on %1$ds extraction time, this is in the optimal extraction range
Based on %1$ds extraction time, the shot might taste bitter (over-extracted)
Record your first shot to see quality score
Record %1$d more shots for trend analysis
Record 3 shots to see extraction analysis
Record 3 shots to see brew ratio analysis
%1$d%% of shots in optimal extraction zone
Coffee peaks 4-21 days after roasting. Track roast dates and we\'ll help you brew at the perfect moment.
By connecting shots to specific beans, you\'ll learn which coffees shine with your technique and equipment.
Photos help you instantly recognize your favorites and remember that amazing bag you want to buy again.
Awesome! Your First Bean is Ready
%1$s is now part of your coffee journey. Time to pull your first tracked shot and see what this coffee can do!
Perfect timing – these beans are in their sweet spot for amazing espresso!
These beans are super fresh. Give them 2-4 days and they\'ll be incredible for espresso.
These beans are nicely developed and still perfect for delicious espresso shots!
Debug tools for development and testing. Only available in debug builds.
Populates database with realistic coffee beans and shot records for testing and screenshots
Adds 10 additional shot records to existing beans for extended testing data
Removes all data from the database. This action requires confirmation.
This will permanently delete all coffee beans, shot records, and related data from the database. This action cannot be undone.\n\nAre you sure you want to continue?
No shots yet – ready to brew?
Failed to get active bean count
Failed to check for active beans
Extraction time must be at least %1$d seconds
Storage is full – cannot save photo
Camera permission is required to take photos
Storage permission is required to access photos
This helps track freshness. Leave blank if unknown.
Adding a photo helps identify your beans later
You can add photos later from the bean management screen
Photo will be saved when you save the bean
Are you sure you want to delete this photo? This action cannot be undone.
Please fill in all required fields
Extraction time must be at least %1$d seconds
Bean name must be at least %1$d characters
Roast date cannot be in the future
Roast date cannot be more than 365 days ago
Output weight cannot be less than input weight
Tip: Record your grinder setting to remember what worked well
Tip: Try a more descriptive name like \'Ethiopian Yirgacheffe\'
Tip: Use letters, numbers, spaces, and basic punctuation only
Tip: Try adding the roaster name or roast level to make it unique
Tip: Use today\'s date if you\'re not sure of the exact roast date
Note: Beans older than 30 days may have lost some flavor
Tip: Notes help you remember what you liked about this bean
Note: You\'re approaching the character limit
Tip: Very short extractions often taste sour
Tip: Very long extractions often taste bitter
This ratio is quite concentrated – it might taste very strong
This ratio is quite diluted – it might taste weak
Consider a slightly higher ratio for better balance
Consider a slightly lower ratio for more intensity
Consider grinding finer or using more coffee for longer extraction
Consider grinding coarser or using less coffee for shorter extraction
Great extraction time! This is in the optimal range for espresso
Very fresh beans – consider waiting 2–4 days for optimal flavor
Fresh beans – perfect timing for espresso!
Beans are getting older but still good for espresso
Older beans - flavor may be diminished
Next steps based on this shot
Suggested: %1$s (based on last use with this bean)
Are you sure you want to delete \"%1$s\"? This will deactivate the bean and hide it from active lists.
Are you sure you want to delete this shot? This action cannot be undone.
Toggle between automatic and manual timer
Enter the amount of coffee grounds (in grams)
Enter the extraction time in seconds
Time must be at least %1$d seconds
Coffee in must be at least %1$dg
Master the art of espresso with precision timing and insights that help you brew consistently great shots, every time.
Three simple tools that work together to elevate your espresso game:
Capture every detail – timing, weights, grind settings, and notes
See your brewing patterns and discover what makes your best shots
Keep track of your coffee collection and optimal freshness windows
No rigid steps to follow. Record measurements in whatever order feels natural – dose, grind, time, and yield all adapt to how you brew.
Get real-time feedback with color-coded timing zones. Start whenever you\'re ready – the timer works around your process, not against it.
Ready to pull your first tracked shot? We\'ll help you set up your equipment and start your journey to better espresso!
Consider using a finer grind to slow extraction (current: %1$ss)
Consider using a coarser grind to speed extraction (current: %1$ss)
Consider extracting more liquid for a higher yield (current ratio: 1:%1$s)
Consider stopping extraction earlier for a lower yield (current ratio: 1:%1$s)
This shot\'s ratio differs significantly from your average (deviation: %1$s, average: 1:%2$s)
Consider adjusting your coffee dose for better consistency
Focus on consistent timing for more predictable results
Shot ran fast – consider adjusting grinder setting
Shot ran slow – consider adjusting grinder setting
Configure your grinder settings to personalize your brewing experience.
Set the minimum and maximum values that your grinder\'s scale supports. This is used across the app to validate and guide grinder inputs.
Set the minimum and maximum values on your grinder\'s scale. This helps the app provide relevant guidance for your specific equipment.
How precise are the adjustments on your grinder? This determines the increment between each grind setting.
Your grinder will have %1$d steps from %2$d (increment: %3$s) to %4$d
✓ Range looks good! You\'ll have %1$d steps to work with.
Coffee Shot Timer helps home baristas pull consistent espresso shots with a precise timer and simple, distraction-free controls.
Turn espresso from guesswork into calm, precise craftsmanship.
View source code and project details
Learn how we protect your data
Made with ☕ for the home barista community
A quick setup to personalize your espresso experience based on your specific equipment.
Configure your grinder\'s scale range for precise adjustment tracking.
Set weight ranges based on your basket size for optimal extraction.
Get personalized guidance and validation tailored to your specific setup.
What\'s the range of your grinder\'s adjustment scale? This helps track your settings accurately.
Set the weight ranges for your portafilter basket. This ensures your doses stay within optimal parameters.
Review your equipment configuration below. You can always change these settings later.
The minimum value must be less than the maximum value.
Check that your minimum values aren\'t too low for your basket.
Check that your maximum values aren\'t too high for your basket.
Try increasing the range between min and max values.
Adjust the ranges to allow typical brew ratios (1:1.5 to 1:3).
Please fix the validation errors before continuing
Please enter valid numbers for both minimum and maximum values
Failed to save configuration. Please try again.
Failed to save default configuration. Please try again.
An unexpected error occurred. Please try again.
Try increasing the maximum value or decreasing the minimum value.
Grinder scales typically start at 0 or 1.
Most grinder scales don\'t go above 100.
A range of at least 3 steps gives you room to adjust your grind.
A smaller range is usually easier to work with.
Set weight ranges based on your portafilter basket size
✓ Weight ranges configured! Perfect for %1$s shots.
Configure weight slider ranges based on your basket size. This helps you stay within optimal parameters for consistent extraction.
Grinder configuration not found. Please configure your grinder first.
Invalid grind setting format. Please check your grinder configuration.
Invalid extraction time. Time must be a positive number.
Failed to calculate grind adjustment. Please try again.
Time was in the sweet spot (%1$ds).
Making progress with %1$s - keep it up!
Still exploring %1$s - each shot teaches something new.
Still exploring - each shot teaches something new.
Following grind suggestions helped achieve %1$d%% perfect shots
